properties.name: debug
properties.description: Enable debug logs.

properties.name: logging.charset.console
properties.description: Charset to use for console output.

properties.name: logging.charset.file
properties.description: Charset to use for file output.

properties.name: logging.config
properties.description: Location of the logging configuration file. For instance, `classpath:logback.xml` for Logback.

properties.name: logging.exception-conversion-word
properties.description: Conversion word used when logging exceptions.

properties.name: logging.file
properties.description: Log file name (for instance, `myapp.log`). Names can be an exact location or relative to the current directory.

properties.name: logging.file.clean-history-on-start
properties.description: Whether to clean the archive log files on startup. Only supported with the default logback setup.

properties.name: logging.file.max-history
properties.description: Maximum number of archive log files to keep. Only supported with the default logback setup.

properties.name: logging.file.max-size
properties.description: Maximum log file size. Only supported with the default logback setup.

properties.name: logging.file.name
properties.description: Log file name (for instance, `myapp.log`). Names can be an exact location or relative to the current directory.

properties.name: logging.file.path
properties.description: Location of the log file. For instance, `/var/log`.

properties.name: logging.file.total-size-cap
properties.description: Total size of log backups to be kept. Only supported with the default logback setup.

properties.name: logging.group
properties.description: Log groups to quickly change multiple loggers at the same time. For instance, `logging.group.db=org.hibernate,org.springframework.jdbc`.

properties.name: logging.include-application-group
properties.description: Whether to include the application group in the logs.

properties.name: logging.include-application-name
properties.description: Whether to include the application name in the logs.

properties.name: logging.level
properties.description: Log levels severity mapping. For instance, `logging.level.org.springframework=DEBUG`.

properties.name: logging.log4j2.config.override
properties.description: Overriding configuration files used to create a composite configuration. Can be prefixed with 'optional:' to only load the override if it exists.

properties.name: logging.logback.rollingpolicy.clean-history-on-start
properties.description: Whether to clean the archive log files on startup.

properties.name: logging.logback.rollingpolicy.file-name-pattern
properties.description: Pattern for rolled-over log file names.

properties.name: logging.logback.rollingpolicy.max-file-size
properties.description: Maximum log file size.

properties.name: logging.logback.rollingpolicy.max-history
properties.description: Maximum number of archive log files to keep.

properties.name: logging.logback.rollingpolicy.total-size-cap
properties.description: Total size of log backups to be kept.

properties.name: logging.path
properties.description: Location of the log file. For instance, `/var/log`.

properties.name: logging.pattern.console
properties.description: Appender pattern for output to the console. Its default value varies according to the logging system.

properties.name: logging.pattern.correlation
properties.description: Appender pattern for log correlation. Its default value varies according to the logging system.

properties.name: logging.pattern.dateformat
properties.description: Appender pattern for log date format.

properties.name: logging.pattern.file
properties.description: Appender pattern for output to a file. Its default value varies according to the logging system.

properties.name: logging.pattern.level
properties.description: Appender pattern for log level.

properties.name: logging.pattern.rolling-file-name
properties.description: Pattern for rolled-over log file names. Supported only with the default Logback setup.

properties.name: logging.register-shutdown-hook
properties.description: Register a shutdown hook for the logging system when it is initialized. Disabled automatically when deployed as a war file.

properties.name: logging.structured.ecs.service.environment
properties.description: Structured ECS service environment.

properties.name: logging.structured.ecs.service.name
properties.description: Structured ECS service name (defaults to 'spring.application.name').

properties.name: logging.structured.ecs.service.node-name
properties.description: Structured ECS service node name.

properties.name: logging.structured.ecs.service.version
properties.description: Structured ECS service version (defaults to 'spring.application.version').

properties.name: logging.structured.format.console
properties.description: Structured logging format for output to the console. Must be either a format id or a fully qualified class name.

properties.name: logging.structured.format.file
properties.description: Structured logging format for output to a file. Must be either a format id or a fully qualified class name.

properties.name: logging.structured.gelf.host
properties.description: Structured GELF host (defaults to 'spring.application.name').

properties.name: logging.structured.gelf.service.version
properties.description: Structured GELF service version (defaults to 'spring.application.version').

properties.name: logging.structured.json.add
properties.description: Additional members that should be added to structured logging JSON

properties.name: logging.structured.json.context.include
properties.description: Whether context data should be included in the JSON.

properties.name: logging.structured.json.context.prefix
properties.description: The prefix to use when inserting context data.

properties.name: logging.structured.json.customizer
properties.description: Fully qualified class names of StructuredLoggingJsonMembersCustomizer implementations

properties.name: logging.structured.json.exclude
properties.description: Member paths that should be excluded from structured logging JSON

properties.name: logging.structured.json.include
properties.description: Member paths that should be included in structured logging JSON

properties.name: logging.structured.json.rename
properties.description: Mapping between member paths and an alternative name that should be used in structured logging JSON

properties.name: logging.structured.json.stacktrace.include-common-frames
properties.description: Whether common frames should be included.

properties.name: logging.structured.json.stacktrace.include-hashes
properties.description: Whether stack trace hashes should be included.

properties.name: logging.structured.json.stacktrace.max-length
properties.description: Maximum length to print.

properties.name: logging.structured.json.stacktrace.max-throwable-depth
properties.description: Maximum throwable depth to print.

properties.name: logging.structured.json.stacktrace.printer
properties.description: Name of the printer to use. Can be 'standard', 'logging-system', or the fully-qualified class name of a StackTracePrinter. When not specified 'logging-system' or 'standard' will be used depending if other properties are set.

properties.name: logging.structured.json.stacktrace.root
properties.description: Root ordering (root first or root last).

properties.name: logging.threshold.console
properties.description: Log level threshold for console output.

properties.name: logging.threshold.file
properties.description: Log level threshold for file output.

properties.name: spring.application.group
properties.description: Application group. Typically used with logging to help identify the application.

properties.name: spring.application.index
properties.description: Application index.

deprecation.reason: Application context ids are now unique by default.

properties.name: spring.application.name
properties.description: Application name. Typically used with logging to help identify the application.

properties.name: spring.application.version
properties.description: Application version (defaults to 'Implementation-Version' from the manifest).

properties.name: spring.banner.charset
properties.description: Banner file encoding.

deprecation.reason: Support for image banners has been removed.
Support for image banners has been removed.
Support for image banners has been removed.
Support for image banners has been removed.
Support for image banners has been removed.
Support for image banners has been removed.
Support for image banners has been removed.

properties.name: spring.banner.location
properties.description: Banner text resource location.

properties.name: spring.beaninfo.ignore
properties.description: Whether to skip search of BeanInfo classes.

properties.name: spring.config.activate.on-cloud-platform
properties.description: Required cloud platform for the document to be included.

properties.name: spring.config.activate.on-profile
properties.description: Profile expressions that should match for the document to be included.

properties.name: spring.config.additional-location
properties.description: Config file locations used in addition to the defaults.

properties.name: spring.config.import
properties.description: Import additional config data.

properties.name: spring.config.location
properties.description: Config file locations that replace the defaults.

properties.name: spring.config.name
properties.description: Config file name.

properties.name: spring.jpa.defer-datasource-initialization
properties.description: Whether to defer DataSource initialization until after any EntityManagerFactory beans have been created and initialized.

properties.name: spring.main.allow-bean-definition-overriding
properties.description: Whether bean definition overriding, by registering a definition with the same name as an existing definition, is allowed.

properties.name: spring.main.allow-circular-references
properties.description: Whether to allow circular references between beans and automatically try to resolve them.

properties.name: spring.main.banner-mode
properties.description: Mode used to display the banner when the application runs. Defaults to 'off' if structured logging is enabled or to 'console' otherwise

properties.name: spring.main.cloud-platform
properties.description: Override the Cloud Platform auto-detection.

properties.name: spring.main.keep-alive
properties.description: Whether to keep the application alive even if there are no more non-daemon threads.

properties.name: spring.main.lazy-initialization
properties.description: Whether initialization should be performed lazily.

properties.name: spring.main.log-startup-info
properties.description: Whether to log information about the application when it starts.

properties.name: spring.main.register-shutdown-hook
properties.description: Whether the application should have a shutdown hook registered.

properties.name: spring.main.show-banner
properties.description: Display the banner when the application runs.

properties.name: spring.main.sources
properties.description: Sources (class names, package names, or XML resource locations) to include in the ApplicationContext.

properties.name: spring.main.web-application-type
properties.description: Flag to explicitly request a specific type of web application. If not set, auto-detected based on the classpath.

properties.name: spring.main.web-environment
properties.description: Run the application in a web environment (auto-detected by default).

properties.name: spring.mandatory-file-encoding
properties.description: Expected character encoding the application must use.

properties.name: spring.output.ansi.enabled
properties.description: Configures the ANSI output.

properties.name: spring.pid.fail-on-write-error
properties.description: Fails if ApplicationPidFileWriter is used but it cannot write the PID file.

properties.name: spring.pid.file
properties.description: Location of the PID file to write (if ApplicationPidFileWriter is used).

properties.name: spring.profiles.active
properties.description: Comma-separated list of active profiles. Can be overridden by a command line switch.

properties.name: spring.profiles.default
properties.description: Name of the profile to enable if no profile is active.

properties.name: spring.profiles.group
properties.description: Profile groups to define a logical name for a related group of profiles.

properties.name: spring.profiles.include
properties.description: Unconditionally activate the specified comma-separated list of profiles (or list of profiles if using YAML).

properties.name: spring.profiles.validate
properties.description: Whether profiles should be validated to ensure sensible names are used.

properties.name: spring.reactor.debug-agent.enabled
properties.description: Whether the Reactor Debug Agent should be enabled when reactor-tools is present.

properties.name: trace
properties.description: Enable trace logs.

properties.name: acme.server.enumerated-map
properties.description: The map using enumeration as a map key. This should produce a property definition per enumeration.

properties.name: acme.server.enumerated-option
properties.description: The value using the enumeration as a value. This should privide value hints for per enumeration value.

properties.name: acme.server.enumerated-options
properties.description: The value using the enumeration as a value in a collection. This should privide value hints for per enumeration value.

properties.name: acme.server.host
properties.description: The host for the Acme server.

properties.name: acme.server.hostname
properties.description: The hostname for the Acme server.

properties.name: acme.server.nested.name
properties.description: Name used by the nested property.

properties.name: acme.server.port
properties.description: The port number used by the Acme server. Defaults to 8080.

properties.name: konfigyr.server.asserting-parties
properties.description: Property that would trigger {@code NoClassDefFoundError} for missing {@code Saml2MessageBinding} type.

properties.name: konfigyr.server.dynamic
properties.description: Dynamic configuration properties.

properties.name: konfigyr.server.embedded-database-connection
properties.description: Property that would trigger {@code NoClassDefFoundError} for missing {@code EmbeddedDatabaseType} type.

properties.name: konfigyr.server.enumerated-map
properties.description: The map using enumeration as a map key. This should produce a property definition per enumeration.

properties.name: konfigyr.server.enumerated-option
properties.description: The value using the enumeration as a value. This should provide value hints for per enumeration value.

properties.name: konfigyr.server.enumerated-options
properties.description: The value using the enumeration as a value in a collection. This should provide value hints for per enumeration value.

properties.name: konfigyr.server.host
properties.description: The host for the Acme server.

properties.name: konfigyr.server.hostname
properties.description: The hostname for the Acme server.

properties.name: konfigyr.server.nested.duration
properties.description: Duration used by the nested property.

properties.name: konfigyr.server.port
properties.description: The port number used by the Acme server. Defaults to 8080.
